name: Gist
description:
View component docs without leaving your working file. Write Markdown-styled documentation and save it directly to your components.


Editing

Select a Frame or Component and open the editor to write your documentation. Use Markdown to style your documentation by adding: headers, lists, images, etc. 


Viewing

View your documentation by selecting anything with saved documentation.


FAQ

Is there a license or a fee?

No. Gist was made for any design team - regardless of their ability to pay. If you or your team would like to donate you can do that here: ko-fi.com/mikewilson


Can I add images/gifs?

Yes - for now use the markdown syntax of ![caption](link). Gyazo has a nice 'copy markdown' feature. I will be adding images to the insert dropdown soon!


Where is my data stored?

The data is stored on a hidden layer on the component you save to. This means your data stays in your Figma.


There are plans to add the ability to sync your docs to Github, but that will be optional and turned off by default.


Is there a max doc size?

No - but its best to keep them concise for the sake of your designers and your file. Since docs are saved to the component, adding a *ton* of content can slow down a file. 


Can/should I add docs to small components?

Keep docs very short on or avoid adding them to smaller components that may appear hundreds of times in larger components and throughout a file e.g. an individual icon.


If you need to document these components I recommend adding a component-specific documentation frame that a designer could grab from the asset panel.
